Best Practices

Tips and tricks to a successful Spot

Though a Spot is pretty much an ‘organic’ tool for community to grow in, there are still certain things you can do to make sure your community stays alive and kicking, and that it keeps growing and attracting new engaged users to your site and onto your user database.

First, the basic steps of building a successful Spot:

  • Spot Name
    Your Spot’s name should reflect your site, keep it appropriate and make sure it’s as clear to your users as possible, so that they will understand the subject at hand and can immediately jump in to the conversation.
  • Spot Category
    Make sure you define a category that is relevant to the subject you want discussed in you Spot, and make sure it also relates to the general topic of your site.
    Defining the right category can help users looking for a specific Spot topic to find you, and can bring extra traffic to your site.
  • Color Customization, Spot Location and Logo Addition
    The color you pick and the Spot location (left or right bottom part of the page), can affect your Spot’s visibility – so make sure you place your Spot where it’s visible and not too ‘crowded’.When choosing a color, try to avoid black, white and gray in order to insure good visibility of all the app options.
    Pick a color that is identified with your brand – the color of your logo, prominent color in your website, etc’.Much like your Spot color choice, uploading your logo will help your spot feel more customized with your brand or website, and make users feel more “at home”.
  • Allowed Language
    The languages you choose here will be the only languages that will appear in your Spot. You can choose up to 3 languages (not including English), make sure you choose the appropriate languages to your audience, and make sure you don’t leave any languages out, because messages written in languages that are not on the list will not appear in conversation.
Once your Spot is created, you need to embed the code in your site. if you’re not sure how to do it, or have any questions or difficulties, check out our FAQ section.
  • Embed Spot’s code site-wide: You can Embed the code across the site, and place a spot on any page you’d like, so that people can engage around the content. You can even embed several Spots in one site with a different name and topic to each Spot. For most sites it’s best to embed the Spot on all pages,  to make sure no visitor misses out on the conversation. the more people talking – the more engagement you get, and the bigger your user database becomes.

Embedded the code? Congratulations! you now have a working Spot in your site.

  • Spread the word: Invite your users to talk about your content and get to know each other in live conversation. users need to be updated on this cool new feature in your website! Post an article in the website, shout out on social media, spread the word in mailing lists and on your radio or TV platforms  – make sure you get the word out there!
  • Jump in the conversation: As a good host, it’s your job to help get things going by answering questions, directing and spicing up the conversation.
  • Talk on the go: Download Spot.IM’s mobile app to converse with your users on the go. Download us on App Store and Google Play.
  • Assign power users as co-hosts: Promote the most engaging users to the role of co-hosts. These users have the best point of view on community and the conversation topics. They will feel obligated to their new role and attract more like minded users.
  • Respond live to actual events: Your Spot entails endless possibilities for user’s engagement around specific events, live conversation deserves blogging during special events, Q&As with experts opinion leaders and celebs, webinars, auctions, trivia contests, etc.
  • Pinup: use the Pin-up feature to focus the conversation by pinning a link to an article or a favorite response to the top a the Spot.
  • Make it personal:  if you or one of the users @mention someone or sends an invite to a DirectSpot, users get notified via email and mobile. By using these features you encourage your users to address each other personally and create a strong community bond.

Got any questions, feel like you need more tips? contact us at: support@spot.im or Contact Us
